result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Welch

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 1:13 PM, 22CF119 & 22CF204. Defendant Matthew J. Welch appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. has Atty John Zich on 22CF119, Status Conference scheduled for today. Atty John Zich appearing for Matthew Welch via zoom. On 22CF204, Def. has contacted the PD Office and is waiting to hear back, scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance today. State reviews case history and notes Def. would like to do a waiver of P.H. and has waived time limits for P.H. Court questions if Def. would like to proceed with waiver of P.H. Def. confirms. Court reviews charges and all potential penalties and goes over waiver of P.H. form with Def. Court questions if Def. should waive right to Atty today as well, State responds. Court finds Def. is entering freely and voluntarily and Def. does not need to waive right to Atty today. Court accepts waiver of Atty form and finds probable cause. State requests 22CF119 set for a status conference and 22CF204 set for a status of counsel hearing. Bond remains.
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

Court calls @ 3:22 PM/ RM 203, 22CF119 & 22CF204. Defendant Matthew J. Welch appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's. In 22CF119, scheduled for a Return on Warrant. In 22CF204, Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. does wish to attain counsel. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State notes no victim in case. In 22CF119, State requests Court to quash warrant and in 22CF204, State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $5,000.00 cash bond, to cover both files, with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances, No possession of dangerous weapons and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State notes has been in contact with Def. probation agent and notes Def. is currently on a probation hold. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond, to cover both files, with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, No possession of dangerous weapons and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. Court questions if Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. Def. would like to waive time limits on P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits on P.H. Def. requests Waiver of P.H. Court will find good cause to go past time limits and will schedule for AIA/Waiver of P.H.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing

1:28 PM Defendant Matthew J. Welch not in court.  Attorney John Zich in court, via zoom for Matthew J. Welch.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Zich has no idea where defendant whereabouts.  State moves to forfeit $1,000 cash and authorize warrant $3,000 or body.  Atty Zich has nothing.  Court moves to forfeit bond pending hearing and authorize warrant $3,000 cash or body, state wide.

1:54 PM Defendant Matthew J. Welch in court.  Attorney Chris Restamayer, special appearance in court for Matthew J. Welch.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Restamayer has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights, bond set and continue and request timely p.h. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:19 PM Defendant Matthew J. Welch in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court receives status of counsel and reviews. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court finds good cause to go past time limits via Nhia Lee Standards.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:15 PM Defendant Matthew J. Welch in court.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case.  Def. makes statement. State heard on PD issues.  Court calls Public Defender office, def. has applied for PD.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:31 PM Defendant Matthew J. Welch appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin.  All parties via zoom.  Court reviews history of record. Def. made contact with P.D.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:20 PM in Room 203. Defendant Matthew J. Welch appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. State heard on bond. Def. on extended supervision hold. Recommends $1,000 cash bond with standard conditions. Def. has nothing to say. The Court sets $1,000 cash bond with standard conditions.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
